utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: You were told what would happen if you came back here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, the last time I saw you in your PJs after 8AM I think you were 4.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We’re off today. Teacher’s retreat.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I didn’t feel like getting dressed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This wouldn’t have anything to do with Ashley, would it?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Did I do the right thing? Breaking up with him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, sweetie, I don’t know. That’s something only you can answer.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It sucks. I miss him a lot.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, well, you’re not doing yourself any favors sitting around reading Pride and Prejudice. That’s just going to make it worse. You might as well be listening to Adele.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey, she totally gets it and so does Jane Austen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know what you need?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: A new life?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A distraction. And it just so happens I know the perfect post breakup routine. Tonight, you and I go get chili-cheese dogs from Gray’s Papaya. We smuggle them in to a double feature at the Angelika.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know you mean well, but I don’t think going out with my dad is going to make me feel better.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, how about just a low-key evening with your girlfriends? You guys can have a John Hughes marathon and fill out a Cosmo quiz.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Dad, the 80s just called … it wants its plan back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon. Gram’s upstate, she’s doing some spa retreat, she’ll be out of your hair, and I can make myself scarce.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: A few of my friends have been suggesting a girls' night. Maybe I’ll call them.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No maybe. You’re going to call them. And you’re going to have a great time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And, if that’s the 80s, tell them they can have Cosmo but I’m keeping John Hughes.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: And if it’s Beckett?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, the Sapphire! In Atlantic City. I love that place. All right, who’s our victim? Is it a show girl? Some big money high roller?

utterance.speaker: KATE BECKETT
utterance.content: No, our victim is Sam Siegal, co-owner of the Sapphire, where you’re always a winner.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, not always, by the looks of things.

utterance.speaker: LANIE PARISH
utterance.content: Guy cashed in his chips between 9 and 11, took a small caliber to the chest. Muzzle flash burned his shirt at the point of entry.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Shooter was standing close.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Mmhmm. Close enough to give him a bloody lip before pulling the trigger.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what’s a guy like Siegal doing in an abandoned delivery dock in New York City at that time of night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Must have been something important enough for him to drive down from Atlantic City.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, the man owned a casino. A guy like that, you think he’d have a driver.

utterance.speaker: JAVIER ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Especially because he was expecting trouble.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He came heavy. It’s a .357 Magnum with all 6 still asleep in the cylinder.

utterance.speaker: KEVIN RYAN
utterance.content: He didn’t even pull it out of the glove box. If he did, we’d be standing over the other guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, you gotta know when to hold ‘em. And, when to fold ‘em.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Know when to walk away, and when to run.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Detective Esposito. A little respect please? I mean, there is a dead body here.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What’d I do?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You broke up with her.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We broke up with each other. That’s different.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, you’d think it’d be different, but no.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Will you tell him?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I told you I’m staying out of this one.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, guys. Call the Sapphire, get some background on Siegal, and look for surveillance cameras or security guards that might have seen something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Women. You sure you want to spend the rest of your life with one?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, yeah. Mine likes me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh! Speaking of Atlantic City … perfect place for a bachelor party.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Ooh, that’s what I’m talking about, bro. We could rent one of these right here, hit the casino, maybe the club –

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, I was thinking more along the lines of camping trip.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, you were … oh.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: First of all, no. Second, it’s not up to you. The bachelor party is strictly best man territory. And, by the way, your big date is what? Like 2 months away? So you need to officially tell the guy so that he can start planning something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I still got some time. Uh, I’m going to go check on those cameras.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What the fu-? Did you see that? He just sidestepped me. What’s that about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s almost as though the thought of marriage fills him with an impending sense of doom. Oh no wait, that’s me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nav system?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, and it looks like Siegal made a stop just before he got here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: 537 West End Avenue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Looks like Sam’s got a friend here in Manhattan.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sam Siegal, 46 years old, got his start in real estate development, then he went on to launch the Sapphire Coast Resort and Casino in 1999.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You don’t come to be a casino owner without making enemies. Look at Moe Greene in The Godfather.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This guy seems to be a stand up citizen. He has a foundation that gives money to charities and public schools.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, check with the staff at the casino, see if he had any meeting here in Manhattan, and find out what time he left Atlantic City.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, if someone asks to meet me at an abandoned warehouse in the dead of night? I pass. I’ve written that scene enough times to know how it ends.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, that address that was on Siegal’s GPS? Turns out it’s a building where his ex-wife Rebecca lives.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How long have they been divorced?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: About 6 months.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Recent enough for there to still be hard feelings.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm. According to neighbors, very hard feelings. There was a report of a very loud argument last night and neighbors said they saw Siegal leaving her place just after 8:30.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s just before he was killed.

utterance.speaker: REBECCA SIEGAL
utterance.content: Yeah, we argued, but I didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Was it normal for him to come and see you after the divorce?

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: No. In fact, I hadn’t seen him in months. We don’t really get along anymore.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What were the two of you fighting about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ms. Siegal?

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: He said he was in trouble.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What kind of trouble?

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: He wouldn’t say. But he wanted me to sign over an investment property that was still in both of our names. A building here in Queens. Just a store and some apartments. I don’t know why, but he was very worked up about it. He offered me $1.5 million for my share, which is as much as the whole place was worth. He said his life depended on it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So this building. He offered you full price of $1.5 million, instead of half, and you still said no?

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: I didn’t know. I thought he was working an angle. I told him I couldn’t sign anything without my lawyer.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And after Sam left your place last night what’d you do?

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: I was in my apartment for the rest of the evening.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the doorman confirms the ex-wife’s story. She was in her apartment all night.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Detective Beckett, just received a call from the mayor of Atlantic City. Mr. Siegal’s death is front page news. They’re asking about suspects.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes sir, so are we.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, how about the property he asked his ex to sign over to him? Anything on that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Um… just that the victim purchased it a year and a half ago and paid cash for the full amount.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, the real estate agent was surprised anyone bought it, it had been on the market for quite a while.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Just got off the phone with Sam Siegal’s office. Apparently, he didn’t leave Atlantic City alone last night.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There was no indication of a passenger in his car.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not a passenger. A driver. Around 6:30, one of Sam’s regular drivers, Ralph Marino, picked him up in front of the casino and drove him to New York City.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then where is he now?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No one knows. He didn’t show up for work today.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Which means he’s either floating in the Hudson –

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or he’s involved.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, what do we know about Mr. Marino?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well he’s no Boy Scout, that’s for sure. Background check shows felony racketeering and assault charges.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Put out an all points on Ralph Marino. I’ll have our brethren in Atlantic City do the same. You boys head down to Atlantic City, to Siegal’s casino. Talk to Marino’s friends and coworkers and see if any of them can shine some light on his whereabouts. Meanwhile, Beckett, you run point from here. Get unis canvassing for Marino, and figure out why in the hell Siegal was so desperate to get control of that property in Queens.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, sir. C’mon, Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, uh… Captain Gates said the boys are going to Atlantic City.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, I don’t think she meant you.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Actually, that’s my call. You’re with them.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Besides, Detective, I’m looking forward to seeing what you can do without him.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What does it look like? You think I was going to pass up a road trip to the Boardwalk Empire? The east coast epicenter of dancing, gambling, showgirls, and sin?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You do realize we’re going there to investigate a murder, don’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gentlemen, if I have learned one thing, it’s to not let a little thing like murder get in the way of having a good time.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And also … shotgun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hey Alexis, I hope you're not answering because you’re busy planning your girls' night. Anyway, I’m going out of town on a case and we may just be spending the night. So I’ll call and I’ll check on you. Love you. ‘Bye!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: C’mon, Castle. We are not spending the night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How can you say that? And maybe Ralph Marino will be very difficult to find. And I think we should start looking at the craps tables.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah… I’m starting to understand why you ditched Beckett. And for the record, the one guy in this car who’s not a real cop is not allowed to call shotgun.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Called it fair and square.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Maybe Castle’s right. I mean, since we’re going to be there, we might as well consider the Sapphire as a potential bachelor party venue.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I’m so happy you said that, because there are a number of establishments down there that cater to bachelor party events. I think maybe we should take a little sampling.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, no, no. We are not sampling any clubs.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? C’mon, bro. Why are you stallin’ us on this?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Look Javier, I – I got some bad news.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I had to ask Jenny’s half-brother Nelson to be my best man.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nelson? That guy I met at your birthday party? 16 with braces? Couldn’t stop talking about being a mathlete?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: It was a family thing. I – I didn’t have a choice.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, you did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, when it comes to weddings, you don’t. Trust me, you do not want to start a marriage with a family feud.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This sucks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: And I was going to give you an awesome sendoff, bro.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well boys, I’m sorry. I’m sorry it had to come to this. I didn’t want it to, but it looks like we have no choice. There is no other way. IBPWOC.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Impromptu bachelor party while on case!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah… smell that? That is the smell of hopes, dreams, and endless opportunities.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not to be confused with cigarette smoke, day drinking, and desperation.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that’s the great thing about casinos. No clocks, no windows, and no judgments.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How you doing?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Maybe we should stay the night.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Detective Ryan, NYPD. I’m here to investigate Mr. Siegal’s death.

utterance.speaker: EMPLOYEE
utterance.content: The concierge is right over there. Nadine!

utterance.speaker: NADINE ESPINOZA
utterance.content: Gentlemen, welcome to the Sapphire. I’m Nadine, the personal concierge. We’re all devastated to learn about Sam.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We’re supposed to meet Sam’s business partner, Charlie Turner. We need to talk to him about one of your employees.

utterance.speaker: NADINE
utterance.content: He asked me to escort you to his table. Follow me. And if you have any other questions about the hotel, don’t hesitate to ask.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Actually, now that you mention it, I’m curious. Who’s playing on the main stage?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just in case we have time to squeeze in a show.

utterance.speaker: NADINE
utterance.content: Well, we’re hosting an Elvis impersonators convention this weekend, so we’re only featuring Carrot Top.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Carrot Top! I haven’t seen him perform since his crazy makeover. It’ll be like a new show.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Uh, no luck so far on Marino. ACPD said that he’s not at his apartment and nothing turned up on the canvass.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What about the building in Queens?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, online search shows that there’s no liens or lawsuits so there doesn’t seem to be anything unusual about it.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Keep digging.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Uh, look, Detective, I know you’re probably thinking that I have you here as some kind of punishment. You’re a good cop. But I think you can be better if you minimize the distractions.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE TURNER
utterance.content: Hell of a thing, losing Sam. You know, he and I started out in this business together? We built this place from the ground up.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Do you have any idea what Sam was doing in New York?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Wasn’t like him. He hated the city.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Yo, Tommy! Good to see you back. Anything you need, you let me know.

utterance.speaker: TOMMY MORETTI
utterance.content: You know what I need? I need my luck to change.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: I’m sure it will.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Big whale, lots of dough.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What about Sam’s driver last night, Ralph Marino? What can you tell us about him?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Not much. He drove me a couple times. Here’s his personnel file, like you asked. Honestly, after what happened between them, I don’t know why Sam kept him around.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, what happened?

utterance.speaker: DANIEL SULLIVAN
utterance.content: Mr. Turner, sorry to interrupt. Facial recognition got a hit on a card counter, table 6, purple shirt.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Gentlemen, I’d like you to meet my security tech, Daniel Sullivan. Same software you guys use to track terrorists, we use to track low-life thieves. Security escort, table number 6, purple striped shirt. Guy’s counting cards.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Wow. Looks like you run a tight ship.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Everybody thinks they can beat the house. If you don’t lay down the law, they‘ll rob you blind.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well, you said something happened between Ralph and Sam. What was that?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Ah, about a week ago the two of them had a scuffle at the bar.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Sam asked this dancer to, uh … blow on his dice.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Turns out, she was Ralph’s girl.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oops.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Yeah, Sam was always a ladies' man and a lot of those ladies were already spoken for. It seems like he was on a little hot streak lately, but that's the thing about luck.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: It changes.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Thank you very much, Mr. Turner. We may need to interview some of your staff while we’re here.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Of course. Nadine can help you with whatever you need.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All right. Thanks.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Guys. Ralph listed as his emergency contact his cousin. Guess where he lives.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: New York City, 8 blocks from our crime scene.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Great place for Ralph to hide out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Going somewhere, Mr. Marino?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: COP
utterance.content: Hold it!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey! Show us your hands. Now!

utterance.speaker: MARINO
utterance.content: I know how it looks, but I swear to God and my mother I didn’t kill him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s why you run away from me with a 9 millimeter tucked into your pants?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Because you’re innocent? C’mon, Ralph. We know that you and Sam weren’t on the best of terms.

utterance.speaker: MARINO
utterance.content: He and I were square. I would never hurt him. Look, all I did was drive him. I wasn’t there when he was shot.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why not? You were his driver. So what did you do? Go for a midnight stroll?

utterance.speaker: MARINO
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, yeah.

utterance.speaker: MARINO
utterance.content: After he spoke to his ex, he told me to take him out to this abandoned warehouse on the other side of town. Said there was someone he needed to meet. He said he needed to meet him alone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who?

utterance.speaker: MARINO
utterance.content: Don’t know. Sam gave me 500 bucks, told me to find my own way home. So I – I crashed at my cousin’s place. And this morning I – I hear what happened on the radio. I figured that with my record, folks would be looking at me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you see anyone else there before you left?

utterance.speaker: MARINO
utterance.content: A black SUV drove up to the dock just as I was leaving, but I didn’t see who was inside.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ballistics is checking your 9, you better hope it’s not a match.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think he’s not stupid enough to kill Sam, knowing it’ll just point right back at him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Sam drove up to New York to secure the property in Queens from his ex-wife, and then went to the docks to meet with someone.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Sounds like someone was expecting the property and when Sam couldn’t deliver, they killed him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why? What’s so special about that property?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ladies, thank you so much. You have no idea. These will not go to waste. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All right, all right! It was not easy, but I did it. I managed to get three front row seats to the burlesque show at the Borgata. Also, reservations at a premium table at the X Club, with bottle service.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Sweet.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’d you guys come up with?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, Sam’s assistant didn’t know anything about the property in Queens, but she did remember something odd about yesterday.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Apparently Sam followed his usual morning routine. He had a massage in the hotel and a meeting with his casino manager. Then after lunch he came back with a bloody lip.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How’d he get it?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, Sam was evasive, but his assistant said it looked like someone hit him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Sam gets punched and soon after he rushes off to New York, frantically trying to get that property.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Then he’s shot dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, it’s gotta be connected.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: The problem is, we don’t know who threw that punch.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I think I know how we can find out.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: You said yesterday at 2PM?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, that’s correct.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: It’ll take a second for facial recognition to pick out Mr. Siegal in all the footage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Do you keep former guests in the system?

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: Sure do. That’s how we flag gamblers with priors.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What about me?

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: Let’s see. Richard Castle.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: Resident of New York City.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: Disorderly conduct, resisting arrest in 2003 and uh … wow. Apparently the last time you were at the Sapphire you accidentally set a mattress on fire and the drapes were covered in jam.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That was a fun night. Check.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: Ah, here he is. That’s Mr. Siegal leaving the elevator, 2PM.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He already has a bloody lip. Can you back that up to earlier?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, am I interrupting?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Just running background on the tenants in the Queens building.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think I may know why someone wanted Sam dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: According to his bank, Sam wired over 10 million dollars out of the Sapphire’s business account yesterday, wiping it clean.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: $10 million? Where did he transfer it to?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: To an offshore account in the Caymans.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: So here he is, parting ways with the pit boss at one of the tables.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No bloody lip yet. Let it play, please.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: Wow.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Is there another angle on that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s Charlie Turner, Sam’s business partner. Why would Charlie attack Sam?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I think I know. That was Beckett. Sam Siegal’s been embezzling from the casino. He’s ripped them off for millions.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Looks like Sam was trying to beat the house.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Charlie laid down the law.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Something you forgot to tell us, Charlie?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Business partners have disputes. It doesn’t mean anything.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: What was it about?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: The thread count on the new sheets.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Not the $10 plus million that Sam stole from the casino?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You knew he was embezzling.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Okay, I knew. So?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: So it’s 10 million motives for murder.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: You know, you may have noticed we have a few cameras here at the casino. Take a look. I was here, not in New York killing my partner.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well that right hook? Kind of looks like a warning to me.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Well, you know, this town, if you’re not careful, it corrupts your soul. Sam and I were partners 20 years and still he thinks it’s okay to steal from me? When I saw he transferred the $10 million out I found him on the casino floor and he denied even knowing about it. Can you believe it? So I punched him and I told him, friend or no friend, he better have that money back into my account or he’d never walk again. So I must have scared him, because I got a call a few hours later and he said he’d have the money back in my account today. And now it’s today and my friend is dead and the money’s still gone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the boys checked security footage and they said that Charlie was on the casino floor the whole night.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He could have paid someone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but why would he kill Sam before he got his money, and if Sam actually stole something, why wasn’t he on a plane to Barbados? Why was he wasting his time coming up to New York?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: And how is all this connected to the property in Queens?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think we’re missing something. There’s some piece of the puzzle that’ll help make all of Sam’s seemingly actions make sense.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Actually, that’s something that Castle’s pretty good at.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Taking a look at what we have and helping to find that piece.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Mr. Castle likes to throw a whole bunch of crazy theories against the wall. Real detectives don’t have the luxury. It’s our job to look at the facts. The bank report indicates that Sam moved the money at 9:47AM via electronic transfer on their website. Now, if we can find out who Sam talked to or met with right before that, we could maybe figure out what’s going on.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sam’s assistant has him ... at a massage.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Yeah. Mr. Siegal had an hour session yesterday at 9. Why?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, we need to know if Sam made or received any phone calls or perhaps any visitors during his session.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: No. He was very focused on the service.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Amber. We know he went online at 9:47. We just need to know if he made contact with anybody right before or right after.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: I told you, he wasn’t on the phone and he wasn’t online.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, what with mobile devices being so small and slim, perhaps he had it in his hand –

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: His hands were otherwise occupied.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Oh, oh! I get it. That kind of massage.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Sam didn’t make the transfer. He didn’t steal the money. Somebody stole it from him.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Ah, Amber, we need to know if, um, perhaps there was anything maybe unusual about the appointment.

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: The only thing that seemed odd was that Nadine called that morning to confirm that appointment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nadine the personal concierge?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Mmhmm.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: And why was that unusual?

utterance.speaker: AMBER
utterance.content: Mr. Siegal’s personal assistant usually books the appointment. This was the first time Nadine ever called.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Wait a minute. Did you say her name was Nadine Espinoza?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, the concierge. That name mean anything to you?

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Uh, Espinoza is the last name of one of the tenants in Sam’s building in Queens. Uh … Teresa and Juan. They run the bodega on the ground floor. And they have a daughter named Nadine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s our connection.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Ryan, bring her in.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yes sir.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nadine’s supervisor said she left her office ten minutes ago. Claimed she needed to go home sick.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Then there’s a chance we can catch her outside.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: There she is.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We’re not going to be seeing Carrot Top tonight, are we?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, honey. It turns out I am going to be stuck here the rest of the night.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, is everything all right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, just the case just got a little … complicated. But I want you to have a good time with your girlfriends.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I will. If you promise to be safe.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Deal. Love you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Love you too.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey Jules, come on in.

utterance.speaker: JULES
utterance.content: I’ve got my fave ‘get over breakup’ snack and a kick ass chick flick. Bridesmaids, of course.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay. The girls are on their way and it turns out my Dad is out of town, so we have the whole place to ourselves.

utterance.speaker: JULES
utterance.content: Cool! By the way, Mina said her boyfriend might by and drop off her jacket.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Isn’t he friends with Brian from homeroom?

utterance.speaker: JULES
utterance.content: Hot as hell Brian? Yeah, I think they’re doing a bros night at the movies.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Maybe we can invite them over, too. All watch a movie here.

utterance.speaker: JULES
utterance.content: Brian.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: JULES
utterance.content: He’s like a total jock. Completely the opposite of your type.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I know. He’s so … not Ashley.

utterance.speaker: JULES
utterance.content: I’ll text Mina.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: So Beckett says plates on the SUV came back stolen.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Most likely the same SUV that was spotted coming out of that abandoned warehouse where Sam was killed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If it was the same car, why would they want Nadine?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because whatever this is, Nadine is knee deep in it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Try neck deep. ACPD let me check into that laptop in Nadine’s work bag. I checked her browser history. Guess who paid a visit to the New Reserve Bank website yesterday at 9:47AM.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Nadine’s our thief?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yep. Our concierge pulled quite a score. She logged in with Sam’s account information and transferred the $10 mil.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So whoever took her is after the money. They tried to get it from Sam, and when that didn’t work, they killed him. And now they’ve got Nadine.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, but we still don’t know who they are.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: There’s only one person that makes sense. The guy whose money it is.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Why would I kidnap my own concierge?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Because you found out she was the one who stole your money.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Nadine stole my money?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: You can stop the theatrics. We know you know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mr. Turner, your casino maintains a fleet of black SUVs to shuttle around your high rollers.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: All the casinos do. That doesn’t prove anything.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Well then, you won’t mind If we inspect them. Just to make sure that they’re all accounted for.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: We’re done here.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Excuse me?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: You people are here from another state. You have no jurisdiction, and you have no warrant, and I believe I’ve tolerated your presence long enough. Get out of my casino.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Are you kidding?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Do I look like I’m kidding? I want you to leave, now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can he do that?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What? How did you guys get kicked out?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Turns out Charlie’s version of full cooperation isn’t all that full.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: The only reason he kicked us out is because he’s behind the whole thing.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but kidnap somebody right in front of his casino? That’s a bit bold. If he knew it was her, why would he wait? Why didn’t he just grab her in the casino while she was on shift?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean, he did seem genuinely surprised when we told him it was Nadine. Maybe he didn’t know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yeah, but he’s the only one with motive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, not necessarily. What if someone else knew what Nadine did and wanted the money?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How would they find out?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe Nadine told them. I mean, that would explain the phone records.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: How so?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Listen, I pulled her phone history. She called a number inside the casino immediately before and after making that transfer at 9:47. I tracked down the extension to a, uh … Daniel Sullivan.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Daniel. That’s Charlie’s security guy.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That would explain how Nadine got a hold of Sam’s passwords. Daniel was her partner. He’s got eyes and ears all over that casino.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, see what he knows.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We can’t. He’s inside the casino, and their security won’t let us back in.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, sit tight. I’m driving down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, no – we got it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Beckett, we – you don’t have to do that. We have –

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No! We’ve got - no, we really -

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah… she’s gone.

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: So I told coach if I’m open on the three point, guard better feed me.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: That’s really interesting. But did you have to invite half of the team over?

utterance.speaker: BRIAN
utterance.content: I like your hair. It’s … red.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Will you excuse me for a sec?

utterance.speaker: JULES
utterance.content: Hey! I need to talk to you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Can it wait a second? I think someone just broke the blender. Who are all these people?

utterance.speaker: JULES
utterance.content: Jamie Cruz just posted an update on Facebook that you’re having a party.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: JULES
utterance.content: He’s kind of a loser, though, so I’m sure he doesn’t have many friends.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yeah. I mean, how many people are just sitting at home waiting to hear about a party?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This is the worst impromptu bachelor party while on case ever.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: This is humiliating. We’re homicide detectives with the NYPD.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Unfortunately we’re in New Jersey. Least we’re not on a ticking clock because a woman’s been kidnapped. Oh! Wait. We are.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: There’s got to be some other way we can get in.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What if I told you I could get us back into the hotel? Past security. All while circumventing facial recognition.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Well, how the hell are you going to do that?

utterance.speaker: SHOWGIRL
utterance.content: Very nice.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you. Thank you very much.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How do you know she wasn’t talking to me?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well …

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: What? Elvis can’t be brown? I’m Elvez.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey! How you doing?

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: What the hell?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: We’d like a word about Nadine.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: You’re joking, right?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does it look like we’re joking?

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: Okay. Why're you guys dressed like that?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: A better question is why did Nadine call you at 9:48 yesterday?

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: You know about that?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We know you two were partners.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who took her? Who was in the SUV?

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: I don’t know. That – this wasn’t supposed to happen.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Are you saying you guys accidentally stole 10 million dollars from Charlie and Sam?

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: No, we didn’t steal it. We were … we were using it as leverage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: To get Sam to hand over that building in Queens for her parents.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: Yeah. But it’s – it’s not why you think. Nadine and I started dating a few months ago. We’re in love. We wanted to start over, move somewhere, but Sam wouldn’t let her go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: They were an item?

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: Ah, only in his mind. She refused all of his advances, but he wouldn’t stop.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Why didn’t she report him?

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: Because this was his casino. Nobody would have taken her seriously. She tried to quit about a year ago. That’s when he bought her parents' building and threatened to evict them if she didn’t sleep with him. I had to do something to stop him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So you came up with a plan to hold the money hostage until he turned over the deed.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: He was going to sign it over as a quit-claim and I was going to transfer the money back. And then Nadine would be free.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: None of this explains who killed Sam.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: Something about the money made Sam panic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What do you mean?

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: When I called Sam to give him instructions about the deed, he told me I stole the wrong person’s money. And he told me when they found out, we’d all be dead.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who was he talking about?

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: I don’t know.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Oh hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We were just leaving.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This isn’t the ballroom.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Let me guess. Facebook?

utterance.speaker: GUY
utterance.content: Twitter. You might just want to leave this open, by the way. There’s like, a whole bunch of people lining up for the elevator downstairs.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Twitter?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Jules, this is a disaster.

utterance.speaker: JULES
utterance.content: Ah, chill. It’s just a party. Have some fun for once.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Fun? I don’t even know half these people.

utterance.speaker: JULES
utterance.content: Well, what about .. um … … um… Brian?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He has the IQ of a squirrel.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, God. My Dad’s going to kill me.

utterance.speaker: JULES
utterance.content: Please. You have the coolest dad ever. If he were to walk in right now I bet he wouldn’t care.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You’re right. He probably wouldn’t care. The problem is, I do.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Everybody! Listen up! The party is over. Thanks for coming, thanks for spilling, thanks for telling every teenager with a pulse. Now, everybody out!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Really? If it wasn’t illegal I’d kick your ass.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I wonder where they took Castle.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: You were told what would happen if you came back here. Now I’m not stupid enough to beat on cops, but you, on the other hand are a different story. I want my money, Mr. Castle, so you better tell me everything you know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know it’s not your money.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Hmm. Would you excuse us?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Who told you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No one told me. I put the pieces together. Sam’s murder, Nadine’s kidnapping, none of it makes any sense if it was your money. I think – I think the money Nadine stole from you actually belonged to someone else. Otherwise you wouldn’t be so desperate. So tell me, Charlie. What happened? You and Sam take out a loan from an institution that doesn’t offer flexible payment plans? You borrowed money from the mob. That’s why you didn’t want us sniffing around here. What I can’t figure out, is how could you be so stupid.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: The banks weren’t lending. We needed a cash infusion or else we would have had to fold. And now the money’s gone. You have any idea how bad it is to default on a loan from the mob?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How’d they find out about Nadine?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Hell if I know. Maybe Sam told them. All I know is that I need my money back.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I can get your money back for you. But I need you to do something for me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who are they?

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: No, no way.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: C’mon, Charlie. They killed Sam and unless they get their money back they’re going to kill Nadine and then you. Those are your cards. Is this really how you’re going to play them?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, um… funny story?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We, uh … look, this is … we can explain.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, I’m not even sure I want to know.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And it worked. I know who killed Sam.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tommy Moretti. He made a hard money loan to the Sapphire 6 months ago and it’s due. That’s the money that Nadine stole.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Felony, assault, attempted murder, racketeering … the Feds have been trying to get him for years.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He was at the bar earlier today. He told Charlie he needed his luck to change.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Probably a veiled threat.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: What if he kills her?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, he wants his money too much. Just stick to the plan. Charlie called Moretti, told him to meet him at the casino first thing in the morning when the banks open.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Once you turn over the $10 million, he’ll turn over Nadine.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And then we’ll arrest him for Sam’s murder.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: Well, what if he smells a trap?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He won’t. We'll be ready.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Here he comes.

utterance.speaker: CHARLIE
utterance.content: Tommy Moretti. The guy’s a sociopath. Problem is, with half the city on his payroll, no one can touch him.

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: You’ve got some pretty big balls, kid, to steal from me.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: I – I’m sorry, Mr. Moretti. I had no idea you were involved. I’ll log on and transfer the fund as soon as I see Nadine.

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: You’ve got a lot of demands for a kid who’s lucky to be sucking down air right now.

utterance.speaker: DANIEL
utterance.content: You said you would let her go.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay, here’s where it gets interesting.

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: Bonny. Somehow figured I wasn’t done.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Take a seat, Mr. Moretti. We got a few questions about Sam Siegal’s murder.

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: You caught me in a cooperative mood, Detective. Now that I got my money back, what can I do for you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The night of Sam’s murder you charged a meal at Carmine’s. That’s about a mile away from the crime scene. That’s a long way to go for good chicken parm.

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: I had a craving.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: For good Italian or for the 10 million dollars Sam stole from you?

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: C’mon. If I killed Sam you think you ever would have found the body? The guy that you’re looking for ain’t me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: But you were there.

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: Sam called me. He said he was having trouble repaying the loan so I arranged a meeting.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, at just the kind of place guys like you like to put bullets into guys like him.

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: You can’t get money from a dead guy. I’d have broken his leg and taken his casino first. Now see, I know all about the blackmail. Sam told me. He said he nothing to worry about because his ex-wife had signed over the property in Queens. The blackmailers were transferring the money back. He was going to drop off the money in the morning, so I gave him another 24 hours. It’s the last I saw of him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Except Sam lied. His ex-wife never signed.

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: Yeah, she did. He showed me the signature.

utterance.speaker: TOMMY
utterance.content: That’s the reason I gave him the extra time.

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: I didn’t lie.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then what happened to the paperwork after Sam left your apartment?

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: He took it with him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s odd. I would have thought I would have found it on his body. But we didn’t. Made me wonder where it was.

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: Maybe the person who killed him took it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, maybe she did.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So uniforms found this in your apartment’s trash bin. It has your signature on it. You did lie.

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: He pleaded with me. Begged me to sign that form. And when I said no, he took out his gun, put it in my mouth, and told me that if I didn’t sign that form that he would paint the walls with my brains. The only reason I was able to get that divorce is because he’d said that he'd gotten old. That he was done with me. And I was grateful. Grateful for a way out. But with a man like Sam … you’re never really out. So when he told me someone wanted him dead, I thought, here’s my chance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So then what happened?

utterance.speaker: REBECCA
utterance.content: He made a call from my phone about the meet. After he left, I took out the .38 that he gave me for our second anniversary, went out the service exit, and I hunted him down like the vicious animal he was.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I’ve asked the DA to look into the mitigating circumstances. They’ll take her situation into account when they offer her a plea.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you for your help on this one.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I enjoy checking out the view from the trenches once in a while.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah well, it helps to be surrounded by a good team.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: You mean Castle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said it, not me.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: He’s not a cop.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but that’s what makes him so good.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: Well, speaking of which, where are they?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I gave them the afternoon off. Apparently Ryan got stuck with an underage best man, so the boys are giving him the unofficial bachelor party.

utterance.speaker: GATES
utterance.content: I trust you’ll edit their side of their of the investigation in the report.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: What happened to you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nothing. Nothing … what’s happened here?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s the … um, where’s the little silver dog statue that’s usually on the back of the couch?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Oh, I think Gram said she needed it for set dressing for her play.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: THE END
utterance.content: CASTLE
